title: 109_hr3832
content: The Act titled "Assistance to Individuals Delivering for America Act of 2005" or "AID for America Act of 2005" provides an employer credit for wages paid to employees who perform volunteer disaster relief services under section 45N of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "AID for America Act of 2005" offers a tax credit to employers for wages paid to employees engaged in volunteer disaster relief services. The credit is 50% of wages paid to employees while performing qualified disaster relief services, with a maximum of $3,000 per month per employee and a minimum requirement of 8 hours of service per day. The tax credit for employers under the "AID for America Act of 2005" is based on wages paid to employees during volunteer disaster relief services. The credit is 50% of wages, up to $3,000 per month per employee, with a minimum of 8 hours of service per day. The maximum period of creditable service is 90 days, and employers must maintain wages and benefits during this time. The term 'qualified disaster relief services' refers to services provided by a taxpayer's employee for an organization recognized by FEMA as a disaster relief organization. These services must be in the area of a declared disaster or in support of recovery efforts. The term 'wages' is defined in section 51(c) and controlled group rules similar to section 1397(b) apply. Section 280C of the Code denies double benefits, and the credit is part of the general business credit under section 38. The text discusses amendments to the tax code related to the employee disaster relief volunteer services credit under section 45N(a). The changes involve adding this credit to certain business deductions and making a clerical amendment to the table of sections. The text discusses amendments to the tax code related to the employee disaster relief volunteer services credit under section 45N(a). Inserting a new item after section 45M. The text introduces a new employer credit for wages paid to employees who volunteer for disaster relief services, effective for services performed after August 24, 2005.
